00:00:02:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:02:020000.Dialogue: Guess who I found at LAX. My baby sister Priya.

00:00:04:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:04:130000.Dialogue: It's really nice to see you again, Leonard.

00:00:06:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:06:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's good to see you, too. Here you go.

00:00:17:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:17:030000.Dialogue: This is a terrible betrayal of my trust!

00:00:19:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:19:060000.Dialogue: Would it help if I told you that I offered her my heart, and she kinda stomped on it?!

00:00:36:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:36:170000.Dialogue: Nothing. Just thinking about the noises people make during sex.

00:00:42:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:42:090000.Dialogue: I do sometimes get a bit carried away, don't I?

00:00:46:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:46:230000.Dialogue: It's cute. You sound a little like a drunken monkey. Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh!

00:00:57:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:57:000000.Dialogue: You know it's meant as a compliment.

00:01:01:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:01:130000.Dialogue: (sighs) This is perfect. I hope this moment never ends.

00:01:16:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:16:020000.Dialogue: Already? Why don't you stay over?

00:01:18:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:18:030000.Dialogue: I'd love to, but you know my mother needs me in the morning.

00:01:25:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:25:220000.Dialogue: I think the woman can manage to put a wig on by herself.

00:01:29:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:29:160000.Dialogue: It's not just the wig. It's pinning her hair up, drawing on her eyebrows. It's a two-person job.

00:01:38:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:38:020000.Dialogue: It's just, when you leave right after we make love, it makes me feel... cheap.

00:01:43:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:43:220000.Dialogue: Oh, honey, I'm sorry. What can I do?

00:01:48:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:48:220000.Dialogue: Okay. Like, what, another five, ten minutes?

00:02:06:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:06:020000.Dialogue: Howard... have you ever considered us living together?

00:02:11:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:11:130000.Dialogue: Boy, I don't know. You, me, Ma living under the same roof?

00:02:16:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:16:210000.Dialogue: No, I mean just you and me. You can move in here, or we can find a place.

00:02:25:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:25:150000.Dialogue: We wait for my mom's heart to explode from all the salt she eats. Then we just stick her in the ground, flip her mattress and move into the big bedroom.

00:02:35:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:35:190000.Dialogue: Look at us planning a future together!

00:02:45:090000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:02:45:090000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Who's there?! Are you a sex criminal?!

00:02:50:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:50:110000.Dialogue: Sex criminals don't have keys, Ma!

00:02:58:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:02:58:070000.Dialogue: I know what that means! I watch Dr. Phil! I hope to God you used a condom!

00:03:06:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:06:200000.Dialogue: I'm not having this conversation with you, Ma!

00:03:09:150000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:03:09:150000.Dialogue: God forbid you get one of those new fancy sex diseases! Nobody has a disease! I hope not! I share a toilet with you!

00:03:23:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:03:23:140000.Dialogue: Is that what you want?! To give your mother herbies?!

00:03:27:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:27:190000.Dialogue: That's it! I don't have to take this! Good luck with your eyebrows in the morning!

00:03:40:120000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:03:40:120000.Dialogue: Who's there?! Are you a sex criminal?!

00:03:43:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:43:210000.Dialogue: I'm still leaving! I just forgot my Claritin!

00:04:19:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:19:000000.Dialogue: I need a place to crash.

00:04:25:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:25:100000.Dialogue: Still arguing over which CSI is the best?

00:04:29:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:29:160000.Dialogue: No, we agreed they all have their merits. This was about Bernadette.

00:04:37:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:37:210000.Dialogue: Howard's gonna sleep here tonight. He had a fight with his mother.

00:04:40:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:40:080000.Dialogue: Did you offer him a hot beverage?

00:04:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:54:030000.Dialogue: Leonard, social protocol states when a friend is upset, you offer them a hot beverage, such as tea.

00:05:06:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:06:190000.Dialogue: And while you're at it, I'm upset that we have an unannounced houseguest, so make me cocoa.

00:05:15:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:15:050000.Dialogue: Point of inquiry, given that Leonard is your secondary friend and Koothrappali is your primary friend, why didn't you seek refuge under his roof?

00:05:24:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:24:150000.Dialogue: There's no room. His sister is staying with him.

00:05:29:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:29:110000.Dialogue: Cocoa, Leonard. Focus. I'm down in the dumps here.

00:05:36:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:36:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, some work thing. Anyway, my mother seems to think that Bernadette...

00:05:41:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:41:010000.Dialogue: Hold on. When did Priya get here?

00:05:43:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:43:030000.Dialogue: I don't know. A couple of days ago. The thing is, Bernadette doesn't like that I have to take care of my mother, and my mother doesn't trust Bernadette...

00:05:50:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:50:190000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's a real pickle. Bye.

00:05:56:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:56:210000.Dialogue: Don't worry. As your tertiary friend, I am prepared to step in and comfort you.

00:06:05:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:05:090000.Dialogue: No, no. I'll finish making the tea, while you narcissistically ramble on about whatever's troubling you.

00:06:12:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:12:220000.Dialogue: That's what tertiary friends are for.

00:06:19:130000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:19:130000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:20:170000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:20:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:21:220000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:21:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:24:100000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:24:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:24:100000.Dialogue: I just want to talk to her.

00:06:26:160000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:26:160000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:28:020000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:28:020000.Speaker: Priya

00:06:29:110000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:29:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:29:110000.Dialogue: You heard me. I forbidded it.

00:06:32:190000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:32:190000.Speaker: Priya

00:06:34:150000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:34:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:36:130000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:36:130000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:36:130000.Dialogue: Get out of the way. What are you doing here?

00:06:41:050000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:41:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:42:160000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:42:160000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:42:160000.Dialogue: I have business in Los Angeles.

00:06:44:000000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:44:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:45:120000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:45:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:45:120000.Dialogue: Clearly, she was sending you a message to take a hike, Mike.

00:06:50:140000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:50:140000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:50:140000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I thought about calling, ♪but I just wasn't sure if seeing you was such a good idea.

00:06:55:040000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:55:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:55:040000.Dialogue: I know. Last time I came on too strong. Can we talk in private?

00:06:58:220000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:06:58:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:07:02:040000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:07:02:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:02:040000.Dialogue: It's completely inappropriate for a single woman to entertain a man in private. If you insist on talking, you must do it on the couch!

00:07:09:050000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:07:09:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:09:050000.Dialogue: All right, you may talk in the bedroom, but I want this door to remain open! All right, just this once you may close the door. But keep in mind I'll be right out here monitoring the situation!

00:07:34:130000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:07:34:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:34:130000.Dialogue: Oh, damn it. Leonard, when you get this message, call me.

00:07:45:160000.Scene: Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
00:07:45:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:45:160000.Dialogue: Priya, this is your brother. When you get this, tell Leonard to check his voicemail.

00:07:54:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:160000.Dialogue: Would you be sleeping over again this evening? Because you're welcome to.

00:07:58:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:58:150000.Dialogue: That's very nice of you, but I made other plans.

00:08:00:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:190000.Dialogue: Well, just keep in mind that should you ever need a slightly apathetic tertiary friend, I stand at the ready.

00:08:12:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:12:010000.Dialogue: Why are you holding hands? I forbid you to hold hands.

00:08:15:180000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:15:180000.Dialogue: Rajesh, you know Leonard and I spent the night together.

00:08:19:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:19:050000.Dialogue: Yeah, but you were just sleeping, because I forboded you to have sex.

00:08:26:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:26:040000.Dialogue: You sure? That doesn't sound right.

00:08:29:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:29:100000.Dialogue: Listen, Rajesh, Leonard and I have decided to see each other again, and you don't get to tell me who I can and can't have a relationship with.

00:08:37:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:37:160000.Dialogue: Actually, he can. The Hindu Code of Manu is very clear in these matters. If a woman's father is not around, the duty of controlling her base desires falls to the closest male member of her family, in this case, Raj. The code also states that if she disobeys, she will be reborn in the womb of a jackal and tormented by diseases.

00:09:02:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:02:190000.Dialogue: If true, that seems like an awfully large gamble given that the prize is Leonard.

00:09:13:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:13:140000.Dialogue: There it is, Priya. We're Indian. We believe this stuff.

00:09:16:230000.Speaker: Priya
00:09:16:230000.Dialogue: I think it also says that if you eat beef, you need to live with cows for three months and drink their urine.

00:09:23:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:23:130000.Dialogue: Some of it makes sense, some of it's crazy. My point is, you can't go out with Leonard.

00:09:29:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:29:200000.Dialogue: Who can't go out with Leonard?

00:09:32:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:32:120000.Dialogue: Penny, this is Raj's sister, Priya.

00:09:35:020000.Speaker: Priya
00:09:35:020000.Dialogue: It's very nice to meet you.

00:09:38:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:190000.Dialogue: Priya, if you're experiencing any tension or awkwardness, it may stem from the fact that Leonard and Penny used to-- if I may quote Howard-- "do the dance with no pants."

00:09:56:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:56:030000.Dialogue: Hey, Bernadette, can I talk to you for a second?

00:10:00:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:00:230000.Dialogue: Penny, you became disenchanted with Leonard as a lover. Would you please tell my sister why?

00:10:08:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:08:050000.Dialogue: Listen, my mom's going to Palm Springs to visit her sister. That's two whole nights in a row I can sleep over with you all the way to morning. Unless the desert air dries out her sinuses, in which case I'll have to schlep out there with the big humidifier.

00:10:18:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:18:230000.Dialogue: That's it? That's your big solution to all of our problems? If your mom's nose holds up, we get two nights together?

00:10:28:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:28:150000.Dialogue: No, it's not great. You need to make a choice. Me or your mother.

00:10:36:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:36:080000.Dialogue: No, wait. You didn't let me finish.

00:10:48:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:48:220000.Dialogue: I came as quickly as I could.

00:10:57:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:57:070000.Dialogue: To comfort you, of course. Sheldon told me about Leonard dating Rajesh's sister. So I high-tailed it over here to pick up the pieces of your broken heart.

00:11:07:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:07:130000.Dialogue: You don't have to be strong for me. Now let's talk about Priya, that man-stealing bitch.

00:11:16:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:16:190000.Dialogue: In situations like this, best girlfriends are often catty about the other woman.

00:11:24:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:24:110000.Dialogue: Really, I am not upset about Leonard and Priya.

00:11:27:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:27:100000.Dialogue: Oh. Then perhaps you don't understand what's going on. Your former boyfriend has replaced you with what appears to be a very suitable mate. Arguably much more suitable than you.

00:11:40:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:40:040000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, good for him. Hey, what do you mean, "more suitable"?

00:11:44:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:44:110000.Dialogue: Well, granted, Penny, your secondary sexual characteristics are reasonably bodacious. But Priya is highly educated, she's an accomplished professional, and she comes from the culture that literally wrote the book on neat ways to have sex.

00:11:59:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:59:150000.Dialogue: Whereas you, on the other hand, are a community college dropout who comes from the culture that wrote the book on tipping cows.

00:12:05:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:05:060000.Dialogue: Yeah. Okay, I got it. I got it. So... what is all that stuff?

00:12:11:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:11:170000.Dialogue: This is a portable electroencephalogram. I'm doing research on emotions and brain activity. So when you start crying, I can see which region of the brain is activated.

00:12:21:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:21:030000.Dialogue: Then I'm going to stimulate the analogous area in the brain of a rhesus monkey and see if he cries.

00:12:44:000000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:44:000000.Speaker: Howard

00:12:46:030000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:46:030000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:12:47:190000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:47:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:47:190000.Dialogue: Yep. I moved out of my mother's house. Cord is cut. I'm all yours.

00:12:53:180000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:53:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:53:180000.Dialogue: What did she say when you told her?

00:12:55:070000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:55:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:55:070000.Dialogue: I don't know. She hasn't responded to my email yet.

00:12:58:060000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:12:58:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:58:060000.Dialogue: This is so great. I love you, Howard.

00:13:03:010000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:13:03:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:03:010000.Dialogue: I love you, too. So what's for dinner?

00:13:07:110000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:13:07:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:07:110000.Dialogue: Well, I don't really have much of anything in the house.

00:13:09:140000.Scene: Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
00:13:09:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:09:140000.Dialogue: That's fine. Why don't we go fool around in our bedroom? And then you can go shopping.

00:13:19:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:19:170000.Dialogue: I thought maybe after we eat, we could see an early movie.

00:13:23:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:23:230000.Dialogue: I love the way you say, I'd love that.

00:13:28:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:28:050000.Dialogue: She says it the same way I do.

00:13:31:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:31:230000.Dialogue: I'd love that. Everybody in India says it that way. It's not a big deal.

00:13:40:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:40:120000.Dialogue: I'm not being a child. Leonard, I swear to God, if your sister ever comes to town, I shall have my way with her.

00:13:50:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:50:020000.Dialogue: All the more shame that will fall upon the house of Hofstadter.

00:13:56:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:56:010000.Dialogue: Ooh, I thought I smelled pizza.

00:13:58:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:58:220000.Dialogue: That's remarkable. If pepperoni were an explosive substance, you could replace German shepherds at our nation's airports.

00:14:08:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:08:060000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. H-Hi. I'm sorry. I didn't know you had company. I don't want to impose.

00:14:12:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:12:070000.Dialogue: No, no. It's not an imposition. At this point, in our ecosystem, you are akin to the plover, a small scavenging bird that eats extra food from between the teeth of crocodiles.

00:14:24:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:24:070000.Dialogue: Please, fly into our open maw, and have at it.

00:14:29:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:29:180000.Dialogue: If I had more than a box of baking soda in my refrigerator, I wouldn't have to take that.

00:14:39:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:39:050000.Dialogue: Hi. So, um, Priya, you're a lawyer, right?

00:14:47:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:47:220000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. It's not boring at all. She's currently helping set up a secondary derivative market which would allow overseas car firms to hedge their investments against potential advancements in battery technology. Hmm?

00:15:02:110000.Speaker: Priya
00:15:02:110000.Dialogue: Thank you, Leonard. That doesn't make it sound boring at all.

00:15:07:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:07:230000.Dialogue: (Leonard chattering excitedly) So, how you holding up?

00:15:13:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:13:200000.Dialogue: Oh, who are you kidding? She's breathtaking.

00:15:17:210000.Speaker: Priya
00:15:17:210000.Dialogue: So, Penny, Leonard tells me you're an actress. That must be pretty exciting.

00:15:23:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:23:170000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, yeah. It's real great. Today I drove to Van Nuys for an audition I thought was going to be for a cat food commercial. Turned out to be porn.

00:15:38:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:38:040000.Dialogue: Given the state of your career, can you really afford to be picky?

00:15:44:080000.Speaker: Priya
00:15:44:080000.Dialogue: I took acting classes when I was at Cambridge. I loved it. We did Taming of the Shrew.

00:15:49:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:49:110000.Dialogue: Oh, wow. I love Taming of the Shrew. I did a paper on it in high school. Who knows not where a wasp does wear his sting? In his tail.

00:16:00:010000.Speaker: Priya
00:16:00:010000.Dialogue: Yours, if you talk of tails, and so farewell.

00:16:03:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:03:050000.Dialogue: What, with my tongue in your tail?

00:16:12:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:12:140000.Dialogue: I'm regretting my earlier cattiness. She is an absolute delight.

00:16:31:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:31:220000.Dialogue: I can't believe we're finally living together.

00:16:34:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:34:020000.Dialogue: Yeah. You know what would make this moment perfect?

00:16:38:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:38:170000.Dialogue: A little snack. You got any string cheese?

00:16:41:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:41:220000.Dialogue: No. I-I might have some cheddar.

00:16:45:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:45:080000.Dialogue: Not as good. You can't make strings with it. Remind me to put it on your shopping list.

00:16:57:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:57:070000.Dialogue: Better put it on the list. If you wash my underwear with regular soap, I get little red bumps on my tuchus.

00:17:06:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:06:090000.Dialogue: Wait a second. I'm doing your laundry?

00:17:09:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:09:140000.Dialogue: Well, honey, it's not gonna do itself. Oh, before I forget, tomorrow morning, you're driving me to the dentist.

00:17:18:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:18:170000.Dialogue: You don't have to take me. You get to take me.

00:17:23:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:23:080000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. Are you telling me your mother usually takes you to the dentist?

00:17:27:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:27:120000.Dialogue: It's not weird. There's lots of kids there with their moms.

00:17:34:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:34:230000.Dialogue: What? It's fun. If I have no cavities, afterwards, we go out for a treat.

00:17:41:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:41:150000.Dialogue: All right, Howard, let's get something straight right now. I'm not going to be your mother.

00:17:46:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:46:080000.Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Where did that come from?

00:17:57:230000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:17:57:230000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Who's that?! Is it a sex criminal?!

00:18:02:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:02:130000.Dialogue: Nobody wants to do that to you, Ma!

00:18:09:220000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:18:09:220000.Dialogue: You know I can't turn on that ferkakta computer!

00:18:14:130000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:18:14:130000.Dialogue: I left you some brisket on the kitchen counter!

00:18:19:020000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:18:19:020000.Dialogue: Remember to floss after. We have the dentist in the morning!

00:18:28:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:28:210000.Dialogue: I just wanted to check in on you.

00:18:31:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:31:080000.Dialogue: It seems like the appropriate thing to do when one's best friend finds herself replaced by a smart, beautiful woman with the smoldering sexuality of a crouched Bengal tiger.

00:18:40:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:40:070000.Dialogue: I already told you, I'm okay with it. I mean, if anything, I'm quite pleased that Leonard has found someone (sobbing): that makes him so happy.

00:18:55:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:55:050000.Dialogue: Now, let's get these electrodes attached and see what's going on in that pretty little noggin of yours.

00:19:17:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:17:090000.Dialogue: They went to Catalina for the weekend.

00:19:25:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:25:050000.Dialogue: I'm given to understand his mother grounded him for running away.

00:19:29:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:29:140000.Dialogue: Oh, okay. Well, I guess it's just the two of us, huh?

00:19:36:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:36:140000.Dialogue: Actually, it's the three of us.

00:19:43:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:43:010000.Dialogue: Good news. Thanks to you, I was able to make a rhesus monkey cry like a disgraced televangelist.

00:19:54:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:54:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you have a guest who's upset.

00:19:58:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:58:210000.Dialogue: - Sweetie, it's okay. I don't want tea.
